metadata.title: CVE-2022-1205 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s AmateurRadio AX.25 protocol functionality in the way a user connects with theprotocol. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-122-generic - 5.4.0-122.138
linux-image-5.4.0-122-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-122.138
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-122-generic - 5.4.0-122.138
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-122-lowlatency - 5.4.0-122.138
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1071-kvm - 5.4.0-1071.76
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1081-aws - 5.4.0-1081.88

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-122.138').
